text: And also more personally what was your journey like? How did you know you wanted to do/liked producing?

I've worked at Nexus for 5 years, right after another 5 years at Passion Pictures.
It was really exciting times, mostly spent my time exploring new technologies like VR, AR, XR, 360 storytelling. I had the opportunity to work on 'Rain or Shine' with Felix, such an amazing film if you havent seen it.
I've also had the chance to producer over 100x idents with Conor for M&S.
They are my absolute best directors at Nexus, together with FX Goby.
It was still a very commercially driven space so after 10 years I've decided to explore longer format, film VFX where speed is slower and the team smaller. So far I am happy with the move.

I've started a bit like you, leaning towards production while studying. Then on I've started as a runner at Passion Pictures while making friends with the production team until they've offered me a PA position, rest is hard work and dedication.

So cool to hear! I contacted Conor for advice on my film last year and he was super nice, and I loved those M&S idents, kept pointing them out to my girlfriend whenever I'd see them on tv. Sounds like a nice change moving onto film VFX, I'd love to know what you're working on if it's not under NDA (It probably is!).
Rain or Shine was phenomenal, one of these days i definitely want to appreciate it with a Vr headset!
